name: Purpose World Church
requirements: Proof of household income required, Bring ID and proof of residence, Registration on website required
info: We particularly focus on helping to feed all that are in need but not limited to the following groups: The elderly living on fixed incomes, Working families considered to be low-income, Individuals with medical or physical disabilities, Homeless and transient people, Individuals and families experiencing a temporary emergency (e.g. an illness, injury, or loss of employment). The following documentation is needed and must be presented to receive food pantry service: Proof of Gwinnett County residence (i.e. driver license, utility bill), Proof of U.S. citizenship (i.e. birth certificate, alien registration card, passport), Proof of possible income documents (i.e. employer pay stub, SSI benefit letter, unemployment document, retirement/pension). Please bring a copy of the documents that will be maintained in our secure data files.

requirements: Drive-Thru Only
info: Rehoboth’s drive-thru / no-contact Food Pantry is open to anyone in need. There will be signs on the property guiding guests to the Food Pantry. The distribution point is the covered breezeway between the Sanctuary and the gym, the buildings closest to Tucker / furthest from I-285.

name: The Latin American Association
requirements: ID required, Requires ID for adults and birth certificates for children in the household
info: We will be serving families by appointment only each week on a first-come, first-serve basis. Families in need of food can contact our Family Stabilization and Wellness department at 404 638-1839. SNAP assistance available in English and Spanish. Utility Bills (Light, Gas, Water) in name of the applicant. Check stubs/ Employment Letter/ Self-Employment Form. To apply complete an online application at www.gateway.ga.gov or on paper with the local Department of Family and Children Services (DFCS). Send in required and verified documents. Also has immigration services available: Call 404.471.1889 or email immigrationservices@thelaa.org.

name: Toco Hills Community Alliance
requirements: ID required, Proof of address required
info: We offer free groceries to those with low or no income in the North Central Dekalb county area. We are currently only serving hot lunches to those who are unhoused on a first come, first served basis. Food services are available from 1pm until 3:30pm on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. All food services are drive-through if you come in a car. If you come in a car, you must remain in the car the entire time. If you take the bus or walk, you may walk up. The building is closed to the public. There are NO public restrooms. Any planned closures (holidays) are put on our website and our Facebook page. We do close for inclement weather if Dekalb County Schools close.

name: Ministry at Holy Trinity Episcopal Church
requirements: Proof of address required, Call in advance for services, Appointments required
info: AN APPOINTMENT IS REQUIRED FOR THE FOOD PANTRY. WE SERVE AREA CODES: 30002, 30030, 30032, 30033, 30079, 30307, and 30317. FOR FOOD PANTRY APPOINTMENTS AND PRESCRIPTIONS, PLEASE CALL: 404-373-9283. FOR UTILITY ASSISTANCE, PLEASE CALL: 404-373-2300. ALL UTILITY HELP IS DONE OVER THE PHONE ONLY — NO WALK UPS. You must be in danger of being shut off. You must have a previous amount due from last month's bill and a current bill. WE SUGGEST YOU CALL EARLY FOR UTILITY ASSISTANCE. We have a limited amount of money available to distribute each day. WE START ANSWERING THE PHONES AT 8:30 AM.

We see clients on a first-come, first-served basis. We offer a daily meal for guests who are receiving services. Those services include documentation, transportation and housing assistance, mailroom services, and case management. The meal is served between 10am-noon.
